trans-unit.source: APPENDIX: BizTalk Services Certificates Overview
trans-unit.target: APPENDIX: BizTalk Services Certificates Overview

trans-unit.source: In <token>af_integration</token>, certificates are used in several areas:
trans-unit.target: In <token>af_integration</token>, certificates are used in several areas:

trans-unit.source: <externalLink><linkText>Create a BizTalk Service using Azure management portal</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/biztalk-provision-services/</linkUri></externalLink>: A public certificate (.cer) is automatically created.
trans-unit.target: <externalLink><linkText>Create a BizTalk Service using Azure management portal</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/biztalk-provision-services/</linkUri></externalLink>: A public certificate (.cer) is automatically created.

trans-unit.source: You can download the certificate and install it on your test/development environment.
trans-unit.target: You can download the certificate and install it on your test/development environment.

trans-unit.source: In production, use a signed certificate; which can be uploaded it to your BizTalk Service in the <token>azportal</token>.
trans-unit.target: In production, use a signed certificate; which can be uploaded it to your BizTalk Service in the <token>azportal</token>.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="5b993139-3261-49b2-a778-f46aee74365b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Manage Partners and Profiles in Azure BizTalk Services</link>: Can be a private certificate (.pfx) or a public certificate (.cer).
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="5b993139-3261-49b2-a778-f46aee74365b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Manage Partners and Profiles in Azure BizTalk Services</link>: Can be a private certificate (.pfx) or a public certificate (.cer).

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="69a4f82d-c339-4780-8761-29f2dd37cd10#BKMK_Certs" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Certificates</link>: Lists all the private (.pfx) and public (.cer) certificates added for agreements between partners.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="69a4f82d-c339-4780-8761-29f2dd37cd10#BKMK_Certs" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Certificates</link>: Lists all the private (.pfx) and public (.cer) certificates added for agreements between partners.

trans-unit.source: AS2 Receive Settings (<link xlink:href="c437391b-9a64-4a18-bd8d-fc551be72bd4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create an AS2 Agreement in Azure BizTalk Services</link>): A certificate is used for message signing and encryption.
trans-unit.target: AS2 Receive Settings (<link xlink:href="c437391b-9a64-4a18-bd8d-fc551be72bd4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create an AS2 Agreement in Azure BizTalk Services</link>): A certificate is used for message signing and encryption.

trans-unit.source: If the message is signed, a public certificate (.cer) is needed.
trans-unit.target: If the message is signed, a public certificate (.cer) is needed.

trans-unit.source: If the message is encrypted, a private certificate (.pfx) and its password are needed.
trans-unit.target: If the message is encrypted, a private certificate (.pfx) and its password are needed.

trans-unit.source: AS2 Send Settings (<link xlink:href="c437391b-9a64-4a18-bd8d-fc551be72bd4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create an AS2 Agreement in Azure BizTalk Services</link>): A certificate is used for message signing and encryption.
trans-unit.target: AS2 Send Settings (<link xlink:href="c437391b-9a64-4a18-bd8d-fc551be72bd4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create an AS2 Agreement in Azure BizTalk Services</link>): A certificate is used for message signing and encryption.

trans-unit.source: If the message is signed, a private certificate (.pfx) and its password are needed.
trans-unit.target: If the message is signed, a private certificate (.pfx) and its password are needed.

trans-unit.source: If the message is encrypted, a public certificate (.cer) is needed.
trans-unit.target: If the message is encrypted, a public certificate (.cer) is needed.

trans-unit.source: Install the test certificate
trans-unit.target: Install the test certificate

trans-unit.source: When you create a BizTalk Service in the <token>azportal</token>, a public certificate is automatically created that is self-signed and should only be used in test/development environments.
trans-unit.target: When you create a BizTalk Service in the <token>azportal</token>, a public certificate is automatically created that is self-signed and should only be used in test/development environments.

trans-unit.source: You can use this certificate to secure the <token>lobconnect</token> (BAS) runtime website.
trans-unit.target: You can use this certificate to secure the <token>lobconnect</token> (BAS) runtime website.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="355e839a-c2ca-48e2-bc2e-e3cd1ad32466" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Runtime Components: BizTalk Adapter Service</link> for details on the website.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="355e839a-c2ca-48e2-bc2e-e3cd1ad32466" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Runtime Components: BizTalk Adapter Service</link> for details on the website.

trans-unit.source: This section lists the steps to install the certificate into the <legacyBold>Trusted Root Certification Authorities</legacyBold> store on your computer:
trans-unit.target: This section lists the steps to install the certificate into the <legacyBold>Trusted Root Certification Authorities</legacyBold> store on your computer:

trans-unit.source: In the <token>azportal</token>, select your BizTalk Service, and select the <legacyBold>Dashboard</legacyBold> tab.
trans-unit.target: In the <token>azportal</token>, select your BizTalk Service, and select the <legacyBold>Dashboard</legacyBold> tab.

trans-unit.source: In <legacyBold>quick glance</legacyBold>, download the SSL certificate.
trans-unit.target: In <legacyBold>quick glance</legacyBold>, download the SSL certificate.

trans-unit.source: Copy the certificate to your test/development machine with the <token>af_integration_full</token> SDK installed.
trans-unit.target: Copy the certificate to your test/development machine with the <token>af_integration_full</token> SDK installed.

trans-unit.source: This is a public certificate (.cer).
trans-unit.target: This is a public certificate (.cer).

trans-unit.source: On your test/development machine, double-click the .cer file.
trans-unit.target: On your test/development machine, double-click the .cer file.

trans-unit.source: Select <legacyBold>Install Certificate</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: Select <legacyBold>Install Certificate</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: Select <legacyBold>Place all certificates in the following store</legacyBold>, select <legacyBold>Browse</legacyBold>, and select <legacyBold>Trusted Root Certification Authorities</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: Select <legacyBold>Place all certificates in the following store</legacyBold>, select <legacyBold>Browse</legacyBold>, and select <legacyBold>Trusted Root Certification Authorities</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: Complete the installation.
trans-unit.target: Complete the installation.

trans-unit.source: You’ll get a Security Warning; which is normal.
trans-unit.target: You’ll get a Security Warning; which is normal.

trans-unit.source: Select <legacyBold>Yes</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: Select <legacyBold>Yes</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: .p7b certificates
trans-unit.target: .p7b certificates

trans-unit.source: A certificate may also have a .p7b extension.
trans-unit.target: A certificate may also have a .p7b extension.

trans-unit.source: In this scenario, import the .p7b certificate, and then export it to a .pfx or .cer format using the following steps.
trans-unit.target: In this scenario, import the .p7b certificate, and then export it to a .pfx or .cer format using the following steps.

trans-unit.source: To import a .p7b certificate
trans-unit.target: To import a .p7b certificate

trans-unit.source: Open the Microsoft Management Console (MMC.exe): In the <ui>Run</ui> window, type <embeddedLabel>mmc.exe</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Open the Microsoft Management Console (MMC.exe): In the <ui>Run</ui> window, type <embeddedLabel>mmc.exe</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In the MMC, go to the <ui>File</ui> menu, and select <ui>Add/Remove Snap-in</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the MMC, go to the <ui>File</ui> menu, and select <ui>Add/Remove Snap-in</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In <ui>Available snap-ins</ui>, select <ui>Certificates</ui>, and select <ui>Add</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In <ui>Available snap-ins</ui>, select <ui>Certificates</ui>, and select <ui>Add</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Select <ui>My user account</ui>, <ui>Service account</ui> or <ui>Computer account</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Select <ui>My user account</ui>, <ui>Service account</ui> or <ui>Computer account</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Choose any option.
trans-unit.target: Choose any option.

trans-unit.source: We are importing the .p7b certificate <legacyItalic>only</legacyItalic> so we can export it.
trans-unit.target: We are importing the .p7b certificate <legacyItalic>only</legacyItalic> so we can export it.

trans-unit.source: Select <ui>OK</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Select <ui>OK</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Expand <ui>Certificates</ui> and choose any folder.
trans-unit.target: Expand <ui>Certificates</ui> and choose any folder.

trans-unit.source: For example, select <ui>Personal</ui>.
trans-unit.target: For example, select <ui>Personal</ui>.

trans-unit.source: We are importing the .p7b certificate <legacyItalic>only</legacyItalic> so we can export it in a .cer or .pfx format.
trans-unit.target: We are importing the .p7b certificate <legacyItalic>only</legacyItalic> so we can export it in a .cer or .pfx format.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the folder, select <ui>All Tasks</ui>, and select <ui>Import</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the folder, select <ui>All Tasks</ui>, and select <ui>Import</ui>.

trans-unit.source: The Certificate Import Wizard opens:
trans-unit.target: The Certificate Import Wizard opens:

trans-unit.source: Select Next.
trans-unit.target: Select Next.

trans-unit.source: Browse to the .p7b certificate file.
trans-unit.target: Browse to the .p7b certificate file.

trans-unit.source: In the Open window, select <ui>All Files</ui> from the filter drop-down, and then select the .p7b certificate.
trans-unit.target: In the Open window, select <ui>All Files</ui> from the filter drop-down, and then select the .p7b certificate.

trans-unit.source: Select <ui>Next</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Select <ui>Next</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Select the <ui>Certificate store</ui> to put the .p7b certificate.
trans-unit.target: Select the <ui>Certificate store</ui> to put the .p7b certificate.

trans-unit.source: For example, select <legacyBold>Personal</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: For example, select <legacyBold>Personal</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: Select <ui>Finish</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Select <ui>Finish</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Expand the Certificate store folder.
trans-unit.target: Expand the Certificate store folder.

trans-unit.source: The imported .p7b certificate is now displayed in the Certificates folder.
trans-unit.target: The imported .p7b certificate is now displayed in the Certificates folder.

trans-unit.source: Once imported, the .p7b certificate can now be exported to a .cer or .pfx format.
trans-unit.target: Once imported, the .p7b certificate can now be exported to a .cer or .pfx format.

trans-unit.source: To export a .p7b certificate as .cer or .pfx
trans-unit.target: To export a .p7b certificate as .cer or .pfx

trans-unit.source: Right-click the imported .p7b certificate, select <ui>All Tasks</ui>, and select <ui>Export</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the imported .p7b certificate, select <ui>All Tasks</ui>, and select <ui>Export</ui>.

trans-unit.source: The Certificate Import Wizard opens:
trans-unit.target: The Certificate Import Wizard opens:

trans-unit.source: Select Next.
trans-unit.target: Select Next.

trans-unit.source: Select the .CER or .PFX option.
trans-unit.target: Select the .CER or .PFX option.

trans-unit.source: To determine which option to choose, see <link xlink:href="5b993139-3261-49b2-a778-f46aee74365b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Manage Partners and Profiles in Azure BizTalk Services</link> or <link xlink:href="c437391b-9a64-4a18-bd8d-fc551be72bd4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create an AS2 Agreement in Azure BizTalk Services</link>.
trans-unit.target: To determine which option to choose, see <link xlink:href="5b993139-3261-49b2-a778-f46aee74365b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Manage Partners and Profiles in Azure BizTalk Services</link> or <link xlink:href="c437391b-9a64-4a18-bd8d-fc551be72bd4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create an AS2 Agreement in Azure BizTalk Services</link>.

trans-unit.source: Select <ui>Next</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Select <ui>Next</ui>.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Browse</ui> to the path to store the exported certificate and enter a <ui>File name</ui>.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Browse</ui> to the path to store the exported certificate and enter a <ui>File name</ui>.

trans-unit.source: select <ui>Save</ui>.
trans-unit.target: select <ui>Save</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Select <ui>Next</ui> and then select <ui>Finish</ui> to close wizard.
trans-unit.target: Select <ui>Next</ui> and then select <ui>Finish</ui> to close wizard.

trans-unit.source: The exported certificate resides in the folder you entered.
trans-unit.target: The exported certificate resides in the folder you entered.

trans-unit.source: When a certificate is exported in the MMC, the original certificate remains in the certificate store.
trans-unit.target: When a certificate is exported in the MMC, the original certificate remains in the certificate store.
